Setting up a data source for a dashboard
Any structural information can be reflected on the visual using
dashboards
. Doing this requires the
data source
, which is a representaion of data systematized according to certain criteria.
The following data source types can be generated for dashboards:
Object data source (
learn more
);
SQL-based data source (
learn more
);
Algorithm-based data source.
Object data source and SQL-based data source
The object data source and the SQL-based data source are formed by combining information (columns) from one or more registries.
In order to configure any dashboard element for data visualization, specify the desired data source in the "Source management" settings in the editing mode of the dashboard visual.
If settings were added in the data source profile, they will be reflected under the corresponding source in the "Source management" window.
The parameter value can be of the following type:
Current date;
Constant;
Dashboard parameter;
Value from the source field.
After saving the data, the specified source can be used for data visual by specifying the following dashboard elements in the settings:
Table
;
Structural diagram
;
Dynamics chart
;
Linear chart
;
Custom highcharts
;
Graph
;
Slider with charts
.
The example of using the data source when configuring the "Table" dashboard can be found
here
.
Configuring data source parameters in the dashboard profile
If the data source contains parameters (inserted into the query structure), they automatically become available in the dashboard profile and can be configured.
For example, the "Client application" object data source with the internal filtering parameter "Car brand" can be linked to the control dashboard.
To do this, follow the step-by-step setup of the dashboard:
1. Setting up the control (the multiple choice element for selecting car brands).
At this stage, it is necessary to specify the "Car brand" object type in the control settings, as well as other settings (as shown on the figure below), and then save them.
2. Click
Save
on the "Elements" panel.
After that, the dashboard parameter will be automatically created. See the result by clicking the
button, and by going to the control settings. The "Link to parameter" field will be filled in automatically.
3. Adding the data source.
After adding the previously created data source, its settings will be configured, the "Value type" field indicates the "Parameter reference". After that select the dashboard parameter.
If there are several parameters at the data source, this action is performed separately for each parameter. The "Control element" is also created for each parameter (if necessary).
4. Set up the result table (with data from client applications with selected car brands).
Thus, the dashboard not only visualizes the source data, but also provides the user with control over the data set returned from the source.
For example, when choosing "BMW" and "Audi" car brands, only the profiles of customers who specified these brands in the customer profile will be displayed.
The columns of the table are formed using the visual (
more details
). The fields available for selecting the visual are generated in the data source, more details
here
.
Algorithm-based data source
If the previously specified dashboard elements demonstrate an incomplete representation of information, use the graphical tools provided by the algorithm-based data source. To do this, go to the "Source management" settings and click the "Add based on algorithm" button to specify an existing algorithm or create a new one by clicking the three dots icon and selecting the appropriate value in the drop-down list.
After saving the data, the specified source can be used for data visual specified in the
Highcharts dashboard
settings.
